name: Copper Oxychloride
target_diseases: Bacterial spot, Early blight, Late blight, Bacterial Blight, Downy Mildew, Black Rot, Leaf Blight
warnings: Avoid spraying during flowering. Wear protective equipment. Do not mix with alkaline substances.

name: Mancozeb
target_diseases: Early blight, Late blight, Leaf spot, Brown spot, Leaf blast, Black Rot, Gray Leaf Spot, Common Rust, Bacterial leaf blight
warnings: Do not spray near water sources. Use before flowering. Maintain 7-day pre-harvest interval.

name: Chlorothalonil
target_diseases: Early blight, Septoria leaf spot, Target Spot, Leaf Mold, Gray Leaf Spot, Common Rust, Potato Early Blight
warnings: Toxic to aquatic life. Wear protective clothing. Do not apply during rain.

name: Azoxystrobin
target_diseases: Late blight, Early blight, Leaf blast, Brown rust, Yellow rust, Gray Leaf Spot, Northern Corn Leaf Blight, Black Rot, ESCA
warnings: Do not use more than 2 consecutive applications. Rotate with different mode of action fungicides.

name: Carbendazim
target_diseases: Loose Smut, Brown spot, Leaf blast, Early blight, Leaf smut, Leaf Blight (Grape)
frequency: Spray every 15 days or seed treatment
warnings: Use as seed treatment for smut. Avoid repeated use to prevent resistance.

name: Propiconazole
target_diseases: Brown rust, Yellow rust, Leaf blast, Late blight, Common Rust (Maize), Gray Leaf Spot
warnings: Do not spray during high temperature. Maintain 15-day pre-harvest interval.

name: Imidacloprid
target_diseases: Whiteflies (Curl Virus vector), Jassids, Aphids, Leaf hoppers, Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus vector
warnings: Toxic to bees. Do not spray during flowering. Avoid drift to water bodies.

name: Myclobutanil
target_diseases: Black Rot, Powdery Mildew, Brown Rot
warnings: Systemic fungicide. strictly follow Pre-Harvest Interval (PHI).

name: Metalaxyl
warnings: Often sold as mix with Mancozeb. Good for soil drenching too.

name: Thiamethoxam
target_diseases: Whiteflies, Jassids, Leaf hoppers, Hispa, Aphids
warnings: Highly toxic to bees. Do not apply during flowering. Use protective equipment.

name: Abamectin
target_diseases: Spider mites, Leaf miners, Hispa, Two-spotted spider mite
warnings: Toxic to fish and aquatic organisms. Avoid spraying near water. Use in evening hours.

name: Streptomycin Sulfate
warnings: Use specifically for bacterial diseases. Do not overuse to avoid resistance.

name: Neem Oil
target_diseases: Whiteflies, Jassids, Spider mites, Aphids, Early stage fungal diseases, Common_Rust
warnings: Spray in early morning or evening. May cause leaf burn in hot weather. Safe for beneficial insects.

name: Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt)
target_diseases: Caterpillars, Leaf eating insects, Corn Borer
warnings: Apply when larvae are young. Safe for humans and beneficial insects. Store in cool place.

name: Trichoderma
target_diseases: Soil-borne diseases, Root rot, Damping off, Fusarium Wilt, ESCA (Soil application)
dosage_per_acre: 1-2 kg mixed with organic matter or 500g in 200 liters water
frequency: Apply at sowing and every 30 days
warnings: Do not mix with chemical fungicides. Store in cool, dry place. Use within expiry date.

name: Bordeaux Mixture
target_diseases: Late blight, Early blight, Bacterial spot, Leaf spot, Black Rot, Downy Mildew
dosage_per_acre: 4 kg copper sulfate + 4 kg lime in 200 liters water
warnings: Prepare fresh before use. Can cause phytotoxicity in some crops. Avoid during flowering.

name: Sulfur
target_diseases: Powdery mildew, Spider mites, Rust diseases, Common_Rust
warnings: Do not apply when temperature exceeds 32Â°C. Can cause leaf burn. Avoid mixing with oils.

name: Spinosad
target_diseases: Thrips, Leaf miners, Caterpillars, Fruit flies
warnings: Toxic to bees for 3 hours after application. Apply in evening. Safe after spray dries.
